name: A vestimenta de um Sambista
description:
"The Clothing of a Sambista"

In the beginning of samba, the parties and batucadas were not well regarded by the police and high society, who considered these celebrations to be the province of vagabonds and troublemakers.

As the years went by, Paulo da Portela, founder of the great Samba School "VAI COMO PODE", which years later would be renamed Portela, instituted a new custom for sambistas. 

In order to be taken more seriously, they had to be well-dressed in suits and shoes to be respected as such. 

And even today the older people, or as we call them: the people from the VELHA GUARDA (the old guard), still carry on this custom of wearing good clothes, such as white shoes, a suit, a silk shirt and a nice hat.

Curitiba, Brasil
2019
2848x4272
2,50MB
